item.title: How to write a custom wrangling function
item.description: This post comes from a Stackoverflow question that I’ve revisited numerous times over the years. The original question: Stackoverflow: Split data frame string column into multiple columns I’d like to take data of the form before = data.frame(attr = c(1, 30, 4, 6), type = c('foo_and_bar', 'foo_and_bar_2')) attr type 1 1 foo_and_bar 2 30 foo_and_bar_2 3 4 foo_and_bar 4 6 foo_and_bar_2 and use split() on the column “type” from above to get something like this:
